summary: Implement SageMaker Pipeline for VBMS User Metrics Extraction
description:
Title - Implement SageMaker Pipeline for VBMS User Metrics Extraction
Value Statement
- As a platform member supporting the Gen-Ann team, I want to develop a SageMaker pipeline that reads user metrics from the VBMS database. This foundational capability will ensure that the data needed for future semantic enrichment (such as similarity scoring and analytics) is reliably ingested and made available, supporting consistent downstream analytics and quality monitoring.Acceptance Criteria * A SageMaker pipeline is created (in dev) with a single stage: reading user metrics from the VBMS database.
 * Database connection logic for source VBMS is implemented and tested.
 * No similarity scoring or write-back logic is included in this step.
 * The pipeline template/script allows for future extensibility to add additional processing stages (e.g., similarity scoring).

summary: incorporate structured output in agent to agent communication in multi-agent patterns
description:
Title: Incorporate structured output in agent to agent communication in multi-agent patterns

Value Statement: As a MLOps engineer, I want to create an example for Strands Graph multi-agent communication using structured outputs, so tenants can use structured agents in graph workflows

Acceptance Criteria:
 * Example notebook created with multiple agents communicating with Pydantic outputs through a graph workflow
 * - Functional code added to MLKit

summary: Create example for strands graph agent workflow including mlkit functional code
description:
Title: Create Example for Strands Graph workflow including mlkit functional code

Value Statement: As a MLOps engineer, I want to create an example for Strands Graph multi-agent collaboration, so tenants can more easily create strands agents with multiple agents.

Acceptance Criteria: - Example notebook created with multiple agents collaborating through a graph workflow - agents using MLKit's strands wrapper for logging - Functional code added to MLKit.

summary: Create Lambda Usage Tutorial Notebook
description:
Title: Create Lambda Usage Tutorial Notebook

Value Statement: As as a BIP MLOps engineer, I want a tutorial Jupyter notebook that demonstrates how to create, configure, and invoke AWS Lambda functions, so that I can quickly understand and test Lambda integrations for data processing, SageMaker jobs, and other automation workflows.

Description: Develop a step-by-step tutorial notebook showcasing how to use AWS Lambda within our environment. The notebook should walk users through Lambda creation, permissions setup, event triggers, and function invocation from Python. It should include clear explanations and example code blocks to help users learn and replicate the process. This tutorial will serve as an internal reference for teams integrating Lambda functions with SageMaker, Bedrock, and related services.

Acceptance Criteria: Notebook Structure - Notebook is created in Jupyter format (.ipynb) and stored in the tenant. Sections include: - Introduction / Overview of Lambda - Creating a Lambda function (step-by-step) - Setting IAM roles and permissions - Invoking the function programmatically (via boto3) - Example: triggering a SageMaker Processing job or workflow Code Examples Includes fully functional Python code cells for: - Creating and deploying a Lambda function - Testing invocation and handling responses - Example Lambda function demonstrates reading from and writing to S3. Documentation - Inline markdown explanations clarify each step. - Includes guidance on debugging, logs (CloudWatch), and cost monitoring. - References official AWS docs and internal best practices if available.

summary: Create deployment pipeline for SCC ingestion
description:
Title: Create deployment pipeline for SCC ingestion

Value Statement:

As a MLOps engineer and the SE for the SCC team, I want to create the SCC deployment pipeline ingest job to include scraping, parsing, and knowledge base update steps so that the entire data refresh process runs seamlessly without manual execution, ensuring timely and consistent updates to the SCC Knowledge Base.

Acceptance Criteria:

- The ingestion pipeline is fully automated to include all key steps:
 - Scraping source content
 - Parsing and transforming data into the required format
 -Updating the SCC Knowledge Base
- Each stage of the pipeline executes in the correct sequence without manual triggers.
- Appropriate logging and error handling are implemented for each step to enable traceability and debugging.
- The pipeline can be scheduled or triggered programmatically 
- Successful end-to-end test confirms that new content is automatically scraped, parsed, and reflected in the SCC Knowledge Base.
- The automated pipeline is deployed and verified in the dev environment.

summary: Update CI github actions for EVA to automate format checks
description:
Title: EVA: Update CI github actions for EVA to automate format checks
Value Statement: As an MLE supporting EVA, I want to create a CICD pipeline for EVA's resources to automate unit tests, syntax checks, formatting, and endpoint deployment so that I can ensure code quality and efficiently deploy model endpoints.

AC: Create Jenkins (or harness) pipeline to deploy Lambda and Agent for EVA domain in dev, stage, and preprod.

summary: Gain insight on Grafana Chart Total Invocations
description:
Title: Grafana Chart Total Invocations

Value Statement: As an MLE I want to have insight into ARIA starting with daily total invocations

AC:
Line graph with total invocations to aria by the day in grafana dashboard

summary: Implement Template Versioning Across All Harness Pipelines
description:
Implement Template Versioning Across All Harness Pipelines

Value Statement: As a BIP AI Dev I need to improve version control, visibility, and reusability in Harness CI/CD, implement template versioning across all pipelines so that each pipeline should be converted and saved as a template, then referenced in the Harness pipeline configuration. This will simplify auditing changes, enable rollbacks, and support standardized best practices.

AC: - Apply proper naming and versioning conventions to templates (e.g., v1.0, v1.1, v2.0). - Provide a process to update pipelines with new template versions while ensuring backwards compatibility and traceability. Acceptance Criteria - All Harness pipelines in the repo are assessed and converted into templates where applicable. - Pipelines use referenced templates, removing redundant in-line duplication. - Templates have clear version numbers.

summary: Create Bedrock Agent CI/CD Pipeline
description:
Value Statement: As a MLOps engineer, I want create a Jenkins Bedrock Agent CI/CD pipeline that can deploy and configure an already created Bedrock Agent (IaC). Build off the Bedrock Agent creation jenkins pipeline.

Acceptance Criteria: - Jenkins pipeline with logic steps and parameters that include creating and attaching an agent action group Lambda(s), Agent configuration like LLM used, agent instructions, "preparing" the agent.

summary: Integrate fortify scanning into Image Builder pipeline
description:
Value Statement: As a DevOps engineer, I want to integrate Fortify SCA (Static Code Analysis) scanning into the image builder pipeline managed by Harness So that application code are analyzed for security vulnerabilities and compliance issues during the CI/CD process.

Acceptance Criteria: The Fortify scanning step template is referenced and configured within the Harness image builder pipeline YAML or UI pipeline configuration. The template step is supplied with required parameters (e.g., image to scan, credentials/secrets, scan policy). The Fortify scan executes as part of the pipeline, analyzing the required artifacts (such as source code). Vulnerability scan results are captured, stored as artifacts/logs, and are visible in the Harness pipeline execution details.

summary: Plan to Integrate cosign into image builder pipeline
description:
Value Statement: As a DevOps engineer, I want to plan the integration of Cosign into the image builder pipeline managed by Harness, So that we have a well-defined approach, requirements, and architecture before starting implementation.

AC: Analysis of the current image builder pipeline in Harness to identify integration points for Cosign. Documentation of requirements for signing container images using Cosign within the pipeline. Identification of secure secret handling mechanisms for Cosign keys in Harness (e.g., use of Harness Secrets Manager or other secret storage). Creation of an architecture diagram detailing how Cosign will be invoked during the pipeline, where artifacts/signatures will be stored, and secret management workflow. Assessment of any validation/verification steps required downstream. Summary of potential blockers or constraints (e.g., pipeline agent capabilities, registry support, compliance needs). A clear plan and checklist for the implementation phase, broken down into actionable sub-tasks.

summary: Attach Custom Jupyterlab Image with new base image
description:
Title: Attach Custom Jupyterlab Image with new base image

Value Statement: As an MLE, I want to validate and attach the new jupyterlab custom image which includes the hardened base image to domains to improve security

AC: Jupyterlab image with new hardened base image tested, and attached to all domains.

summary: BDA Processing Template Python Script in Tenant Resources
description:
Title: Add BDA Processing Template Python Script with Blueprint Invocation to Tenant Resources

Value Statement: As an MLOps engineer, I want a Python script template for BDA processing in Tenant Resources that invokes projects using a blueprint, so that tenants can standardize processing workflows and quickly run projects with minimal setup.

Acceptance Criteria: -A reusable Python script template is created for BDA processing. -Script includes logic to invoke a BDA project using a blueprint. -Script is added to the Tenant Resources repository/notebook. -Validate that running the script successfully triggers the project according to the blueprint. -Script includes clear instructions and placeholders for tenant-specific configuration.

summary: Validate cost tracking into BDA
description:
Title: Validate Cost Tracking Integration in Bedrock Data Automation (BDA)

Value Statement: As an MLOps engineer, I need to ensure that cost tracking is accurately integrated into BDA, so that we can reliably monitor and manage usage and expenses associated with Bedrock workloads.

Acceptance Criteria: Confirm that all cost metrics from BDA usage are correctly captured.

summary: Update fetch operations in gen-ai module and test functionality in bedrock notebooks
description:
Title: Fix and Generalize Fetch Operations in Gen-AI Module

Value Statement: As a tenant user who retrieves resources for use case development, I need the ability to fetch only the resources associated with my tenant across knowledgebases, Bedrock projects, agents, and any other bedrock associated resources so that data access is accurate, consistent, and aligned with tenant-specific permissions.

Acceptance Criteria: -When a tenant fetches resources through the gen-ai module, only tenant-associated resources are listed across knowledgebases, Bedrock projects, and agents. -When the updated fetch logic is deployed, running tenant notebooks in Bedrock confirms correct and complete resource retrieval. -Documentation in the gen-ai module is updated to reflect the new fetch behavior and tenant filtering logic. -manual validation steps are included in Bedrock notebooks to confirm functionality.

summary: Determine/document deployment architecture w/ support for statefulness
description:
Title: Determine/document deployment architecture w/ support for statefulness

Value Statement: As an MLE creating and deploying strands agents, I want to document how a deployed agent can leverage context in repeated responses

AC: Documentation created that describes how a deployed strands agent (lambda or K8) can save conversation history or other context. Should describe what tools to use (dynamoDB, s3, etc), how to connect to those tools, tagging, etc.

summary: Identify Key Observability Metrics for AWS Bedrock Agents
description:
Title: Identify Key Observability Metrics for AWS Bedrock Agents

Value Statement:
As an MLOps engineer who supports observability for generative AI workloads, I need the ability to identify and define key operational and performance metrics for AWS Bedrock agents so that we can establish consistent, meaningful monitoring standards that inform Grafana dashboards and alerting strategies.

Acceptance Criteria:
- When the evaluation is complete, the engineer has documented a list of recommended Bedrock agent metrics (e.g., latency, token usage, invocation counts, error rates, and throughput) aligned with observability best practices.
- When the metrics are defined, the documentation includes clear metric definitions, data sources, and collection frequency for future integration with Grafana.
- When documentation is finalized, the findings are published in Confluence and linked to this JIRA story for reference.

summary: BDA Project Setup Template Python Script in Tenant Resources
description:
Title: Add BDA Project Setup Template Python Script to Tenant Resources

Value Statement: As an MLOps engineer, I want a Python script template for BDA project setup in Tenant Resources, so that tenants can quickly and consistently initialize Bedrock Data Automation projects with minimal manual setup.

Acceptance Criteria: -A reusable Python script template is created for BDA project setup. -Script is added to the Tenant Resources repository/notebook. -Script includes clear instructions and placeholders for tenant-specific configuration. -Validate that running the script initializes a BDA project correctly without errors.

summary: Evaluate Langfuse and OpenTelemetry Integration Options for Gen-AI Observability
description:
Title: Evaluate Langfuse and OpenTelemetry Integration Options for AWS Bedrock Observability

Value Statement: As an MLOps engineer who maintains observability for generative AI workloads, I need the ability to evaluate and plan how Langfuse and OpenTelemetry can be integrated with AWS Bedrock services (including agents, knowledge bases, and related components) so that we can establish a standardized, extensible observability framework for tracing, metrics, and performance monitoring across tenant use cases.

Acceptance Criteria: -When the evaluation is complete, the engineer has documented a comparison of Langfuse and OpenTelemetry capabilities for generative AI observability (e.g., trace collection, metadata tagging, latency metrics, and cost considerations). -When integration points are identified, the engineer has outlined a proposed architecture and integration plan for using one or both tools with AWS Bedrock (covering agents, knowledge bases, and related AWS components). -When documentation is finalized, the findings and recommendations are published in confluence and linked to this JIRA story for reference.

summary: Deployment of a Strands Agent in K8 (working with Infra on IAC)
description:
Title: Deployment of a Strands agent in K8 Value Statement: As a BIP‑AI MLOps Engineer, I need a full‑featured RAF-Strands deployed in Kubernetes so I can demonstrate the deployment pattern of deployment and how to query it.

AC: Basic strands agent deployed in dev, along with proper helm charts, dockerfile, image builder process, and notebook in tenant-resources demonstrating how to query it.

summary: Implement Grafana Deployment via Crossplane for AI/ML Observability
description:
User Story: As a BIP-AI infrastructure engineer, I want to implement Grafana deployment using Crossplane based on the approved architecture design, so that our AI/ML teams can provision and manage Grafana instances through Infrastructure as Code with GitOps workflows.

Acceptance Criteria: Crossplane Composition templates are created in templates/ directory supporting the approved deployment pattern (self-hosted or Grafana Cloud) Crossplane Claims are developed in claims/ directory with examples for different environments (dev, staging, production) Compositions support required data sources (Prometheus, CloudWatch, SageMaker, RDS) with secrets management integration ADFS/SSO and RBAC configurations are implemented per BIP-AI security requirements Existing MLE Grafana templates are migrated to Crossplane Composition format with documented migration path ArgoCD Application manifests are configured to deploy Grafana instances with environment-specific value overrides Repository structure and GitOps workflow (template updates → ArgoCD sync → cluster deployment) is documented in README At least one successful Grafana deployment is validated in dev environment Dependencies: Approved architecture diagram and design document from research ticket Access to existing MLE Grafana templates and deployment patterns

summary: Research Crossplane functionality for BIP AI implementation and deploying resources
description:
Value Statement: As an infra engineer I need to become familiar with the Crossplane IaC tool and how it's being leveraged for resources deployment/management by the BIP AI team.

AC: I have developed general knowledge of the Crossplane IaC tool, in order to support the BIP AI Infra team with Crossplane related tasks.

summary: Test Auto-tag system
description:
Value Statement: As a member of the BIP-AI infrastructure team, I need to smoke test the Auto-tagger in an ephemeral cluster to ensure it transfers well from development to production.

A/C: - Smoke test the Auto-Tagger system to ensure it behaves correctly when deployed to our infrastructure

summary: Fix Bedrock KB provider
description:
Value Statement: As a member of the BIP-AI infrastructure team, I need to troubleshoot our custom Bedrock knowledgebase provider, so that it doesn't stay in 'outOfSync' state.

A/C: - Investigate and troubleshoot why our custom Bedrock stays in an outOfSync state in Argo on both SBX and DEV. This didn't happen during initial testing. Need to dig and come up with a fix.

summary: Solution code signing enforcement from AWS image and lambda services to verify workload integrity
description:
Title
Solution code signing enforcement from AWS image and lambda services to verify workload integrity

Value Statement
As a BIP AI infra engineer who designs the platform to run containerized and lambda based workloads, I need the ability to enforce code signing standard to the images and lambda code so that only properly cosigned workloads from harness pipeline can run in the AI platform.

Acceptance Criteria

1 Investigate examples of code signing enforcement in both image and lamba services in AWS.
2. Draw architecture design for code signing enforcement.
3. Also look at ECR repo permission policy to allow image promotion pipeline to run on all `/mlmats` images.

summary: Add audit logging to mlops api to improve traceability
description:
Title
Add audit logging to mlops api to improve traceability

Value Statement
As a BIP AI infra engineer who design gateway app, I need the ability to add audit logs on the mlops api so that tenant user's additional gateway app functionalities can be logged and traced to that particular user.

Acceptance Criteria

1 Add well formatted audit logs to each and every mlops api.
2 Relevant Logs can be filtered and displayed in Grafana dashboard.

summary: SCC: Create M21 KB in stage and pre-prod
description:
Title: SCC: Create M21 Knowledge Base in Stage and Pre-Prod

Value Statement: As a MLOps engineer and the SE for the SCC team, I want to create M21 Knowledge Base instances in the stage and pre-prod environments so that the same content and configuration available in dev can be validated and tested across higher environments before production deployment.

Acceptance Criteria: M21 Knowledge Base instances are created in stage and pre-prod. Each instance mirrors the structure, content, and configuration of the dev M21 Knowledge Base. Data sources and ingestion pipelines are connected and verified in both environments. Environment-specific parameters (roles, ARNs, bucket paths, IDs) are correctly configured. SCC tenants are checked to ensure they have corresponding KB access privileges in stage and pre-prod. End-to-end validation confirms that stage and pre-prod knowledge bases return responses consistent with dev.

Enable logging for high level metrics
description:
Title:
Enable logging for Bedrock resource count

Value Statement:
As an MLOps engineer who adds Bedrock resources that trigger a Lambda to list resources, I need the ability to enable logging of Bedrock resource counts into CloudWatch Metrics so that I can reliably track service quota limits.Acceptance Criteria:
- When a user adds, updates, or removes a Bedrock resource (triggering the listing Lambda), the user has the ability to see the updated Bedrock resource count in CloudWatch Metrics.
- The Lambda publishes a CloudWatch metric as a trigger to adding additional resources returned and dimensions
- Metrics are visible in the AWS CloudWatch Metrics
- Minimum resources include: knowledge bases, inference profile, blueprints, agents

summary: 1.4 - On Call Infra Service Desk
description:
Value Statement: As a BIP AI engineer I need to be On Call so that any service desk tickets that are submitted are addressed in a timely manner.
AC: # Be available and monitor the Service Desk ticket board
 # Address any tickets that come in and begin support
 # Provide continual updates to tickets
 # Reassign to developers as needed
